Articles.Content: Tesla is adding a ludicrous mode to their car, what are your thoughts?

0 to 60 in under 3 seconds? Impressive for any car, more impressive for electric. Still, nobody was asking for it and it'll cost $10,000 more, so I don't foresee a huge number of Teslas with this feature being sold.

That sounds cool. Who are Tesla? don't they have something to do with cars? Is this about the... I'm sorry. I don't really have much to say here. \*points at signature\* I just HAD to post in a thread called "Ludicrous Speed."

I do know who Tesla are, yes.

Tesla's an electric car company founded by Elon Musk, who also founded SpaceX.

At first I thought it was about the movie:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ygE01sOhzz0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Though a super-accelerating Tesla is also nice I suppose.

$10,000 more? Who would want it?

Lets wait and see if any Police department wants to convert to electric .... that option will then be a necessity, I would think.

It doesn't sound as if Tesla's planning to have the car travel at 'ludicrous speed,' only to have ludicrous *acceleration*. I know I'm being pedantic, but this mode doesn't sound as if it'll increase the car's top speed, only the rate at which it reaches its top speed.

Even though this is an important step in the right direction for cars, only when a vehicle can 'go to Plaid' will I be happy...

-Upsilon

I rode in a friend's Tesla and it was unbelievably fast!

I own a Mitsubishi i-Miev electric car. So, not quite the same specs as a Tesla machine, but I gotta tell ya, I love the electric cars. Next time you are in the market for a vehicle, please consider it! And kudos to them for continuing to push the boundaries of technology, they are to be admired, even if none of us can afford to buy their products.
